text: jcodec seems to be in maven, and it was just updated last week: <http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.jcodec%22>
I'm not any closer to understanding how to make an ffmpeg native API, even though I can load the libffmpeg.so that evans built :confused:
<@U02F8TTPU>: lets talk about it after I'm done doing the thing I'm doing
also: if you could help and let me know if jcodec in maven is the android version
I'm pretty sure the version in maven is not android, but I'll try using it and see what happens
There's a recent android/jcodec example on github, this looks like something worth studying <https://github.com/truongluong1314/JCodecAndroidDemo>

text: the jcodec in maven doesn't contain the org.jcodec.scale.* classes which this example uses
I'll try building the version specifically packaged for android
ok! I think I wandered off of doing that
I built the library and got the demo app running! it doesn't make a video yet (some nullpointerexception) but it's progress
Still trying to understand the demo and fix bugs... I put a copy of where I'm at with the demo on the NAS at /Volumes/clients/Google Creative Lab/See_Say/dev
